content: I'm getting ready to cut a new stable version of FHIR. Does anyone have any last minute submissions to make?
I know that the EBM on FHIR group has a draft resource they want to submit for use at the connectathon as part of the COVID-19 accelerator they are working on. @Khalid Shahin ?

Yes, @Bryn Rhodes , we want to create two new resources and a profile for Composition. I was planning on creating these on Friday, but I can do it sooner if it's needed.

Also I have some cleanup changes for removal of unused resources that I'm ready to commit, but I have a question about one file: https://chat.fhir.org/#narrow/stream/179165-committers/topic/Difficulties.20running.20publish.20on.20new.20installations/near/195692023
what's not fixed there?

Grahame Grieve said:

what's not fixed there?

For some reason I copied the wrong link. Here's the correct one: https://chat.fhir.org/#narrow/stream/179165-committers/topic/Handling.20removed.20resources.20in.20resource-name-tracker.2Exml/near/195740164
@Grahame Grieve When are you planning to do this (I don't think you already have)? I should try to get the additional ConcpetMap changes in, if possible.

I have a few changes to do on Device - depending on when you do release, I can squeeze in a few changes.
the ones I think are more important/feasible:

  • Remove URL from DeviceDefinition
  • DeviceDefinition to FMM1
  • A few simple changes to Device that were requested by @Brian Reinhold and others
well, you have 20 hours
thanks
so about 15 now, then?
I was just reminded of one missing fix, I'm now running the build locally, will commit right away (I hope)
i just made a PR, I don't think it triggered the build
do i need to do anything to trigger it?
https://github.com/HL7/fhir/pull/860

@Grahame Grieve should I give it some time, or I have to do something?
I don't see anything here https://dev.azure.com/fhir-build/build.fhir.org/_build
@Josh Mandel ?
@Jose Costa Teixeira try committing a whitespace change to get it to initiate again
that seems to have unblocked it
yes, it's working. thanks
How much time do we have to submit our changes into the FHIR build?
a few hours.
probably 5
If I'm making new resources, should I add them in the "resource-name=tracker.xml" under the R4 column?
no because you are not adding them to R4
I have the ConceptMap updates coming.
I have two resources working in my local build, and I'm working on the Profile.
ok I'm about 2 hours away from needing to commit
I think I'm (slightly) ahead of that. But checking the build takes a pretty long time.

I got the work done, I'm doing a fresh local build of it to make sure there are no errors. A few things were causing problems, one was the resources needed "useContext" and other fixes that didn't show up initially.
My local build is process, I estimate 15 more minutes until it's done. And then I'll PR and merge the branch.
I'm still working on a local build, following the org.hl7.fhir.core updates..
ok ar we done now?
The local build for me is taking longer than expected, but it should be just a few more minutes. But then there would be the online check before the merge.
Unfortunately the build failed late in the process and now I'm getting a NullPointerException on publish.
where?
On my local computer build.
yes but where in the build?
profiles-resources and structure definition
"validate profiles-resources"
did you get a stack dump?
I did, but I cleared it.
I had to fix one element in the resource. I think it could build now, but the local build will take another 45 minutes. And I don't suppose I can skip that local build step right?
you need to get to where it says "Produce Content" before you commit. but then you can

Kind of weird. I recloned and reapplied my changes and I get this error early on.

 [java] FHIR build failure @ Fri, May 1, 2020 01:08-0400                           2.324  27sec 1989MB
 [java] Error: null

BUILD FAILED
C:\Users\Khalid\Documents\GitHub\fhir\build.xml:30: The following error occurred while executing this line:
C:\Users\Khalid\Documents\GitHub\fhir\tools\java\org.hl7.fhir.tools.core\build.xml:70: Java returned: 1
you're missing a max cardinality on some element you defined
something has come up here - you have another hour
I got to produce content. Committed the branch and I'm doing the PR merge check at this moment. I will tell you if it's successful and merged.

Passed the check, and merged. I made two draft resources and in order for the build to work I had to edit these files to include the names of the resources:
source\fhir.ini
source\hiearchy.xml
source\status-codes.xml
source\compartments.xml
implementations\translations.xml

Is it okay that I changed these files and merged?

(I had two PR merges tonight by the way.)

I can't build the updates in the fhir build locally right now with the dependency on org.hl7.fhir.core, but I'll create a PR and you can see about it from there. The org.hl7.fhir.core PR failed validation - not sure what that's about, excactly, as it works here.
Need to update the 'broader' relationship in ConceptMap-cm-address-use-v2.json to 'source-is-narrower-than-target'.
But didn't locate the source for that yet.
that's generated
right - looked like it was - that's why I couldn't find the source :)
updating concept map is very very difficult now.
what exactly are the changes?

I know
it's the two relationships:
'broader' to 'source-is-narrower-than-target'
'narrower' to 'source-is-broader-than-target'
and some bits of associated documentation

these are the changes that Vocab approved (again) in Sydney and have been wanting - and would like to review and test in the Connectathon - but if you decide we can't get it in the milestone, then afterward we can keep working on the PRs and get it in the CI build
Not that I really wanted to do this at all. ;) But had to get it done.
And I need to get some sleep soon.
hmm. well today isn't working out for me at all
I've just slipped 24 hours :-(
There's always something. I'll be back up in maybe 5 hours or so.
I'll take over. You can't do that one
ok I have it building with no errors, but the validator is broken. Changing this code system is getting really really hard.

Right, thanks. Yes, it is getting very hard to change - but hopefully we'll be able to stop doing that. I'm not hugely thrilled with this particular change, but it is at least clear what it means, which was the goal.
we'll be changing it at least once more because 'source-is-narrower-than-target' is horrible. source-narrower would suffice
I agree. I tried to persuade them to do something more like that (or 'broader-target' or 'has-broader-target'). :(
Oddly enough, the Citation resource page is missing: http://hl7.org/fhir/2020May/citation.html
I'll investigate
